STUDIOS—UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON
CHANNEL
KCTSfTV)
TRANSMITTER—EDISON TECHNICAL SCHOOL
C&WftONli* TELEVISION SERVICE
SEATTLE 5, WASHINGTON
To: All ETV station managers
From: Loren Stone
I regret finding myself in complete disagreement with Bill
Harley on the matter of NAEBfs entering into television
program productions, but I am —■ and feel constrained to
write each of you expressing my concern0
Attabhed is a copy of a memorandum I recently sent to the
ETV stations in NAEB Region VIf which I have been represent-
ing as TV director, which essentia-ly states my opinion0
If you are one of the "stations (which) have indicated a
need for more distinctive ETV programs than are currently
available from regular sources” to quote Bill#s May 25th
memorandum, you should give him the encouragement he is
seeking«
If, however, you are concerned over the potential dilution of
NETRC’s efforts to produce good programming for us within the
ability of the stations to pay and of the availability of outside
underwriting, then I hope you will express that concern to him0
cc: Bill Harley, President, NAEB
Dick Hull, Chairman of full board, NAEB
Ray Hurlburt, Chairman TV Board, NAEB
RECEIVED
NAEB HEADQUARTERS
JUN £> 1962
